page.title: 01Landscape Outline-Yetholm
page.content: {Town Yetholm}and{Kirk Yetholm,}two delightful villages set in a valley, under the Cheviot Hills, on either side of the{Bowmont Water}are grouped round pleasant greens and right on the border with England at the end of the {Pennine Way. The former, larger and more built up supports the only shops but the area as a whole has suffered the curtailment of services which has affected most rural areas. One shop, a public house and police station being the most recent casualties. Kirk Yetholm, the former capital of the scots gypsies, is situated at the end of the{Pennine Way}and is quieter and more rural. The area itself is one with a great wealth of beauty, rich in wild-life and folklore with some of the best picnic sites imaginable amongst marvellous rural countryside.
